weather_report:
Subiaco wakes under a quilt of soft grey, the morning light muted and thoughtful. Clouds are thickening ahead of a band of light rain due late morning and again after lunch, so any sunshine will be brief and filtered, more a pale shimmer than a blaze. The day won’t feel crisp so much as gently blurred at the edges, the air clear enough but the sky smudged, and though the clouds take the harshness off the glare, late-spring UV can still sneak through around midday.

Dress in light layers with a compact rain shell, shoes happy to meet damp pavements, and keep a small umbrella at the ready; carry sunscreen and a brim for those passing bright spells. It’s a good day for unhurried errands between showers, a meander through Subiaco’s shops and arcades, or a quiet perch by a café window while the rain stipples the street. If you’re staying close to home, tackle a small project, then take a short stroll when the drizzle slackens; the jacarandas will lend the air that faint violet perfume that makes the grey feel kind.
